alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; McKean; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 8:48AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF WARREN...MCKEAN... CAMERON...CLEARFIELD...AND ELK COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by wind gusts up to 50 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 845 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from Meadville to near Punxsutawney and moving northeast at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... St. Marys, Warren, Bradford, DuBois, Clearfield, Ridgway, Kane, Johnsonburg, Allegany State Park, Sandy, Cameron, Woodland, Curwensville, Port Allegany, Sheffield, Emporium, Columbus, Youngsville, Smethport and Wetmore. For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Dubois and Kylertown exits, specifically from mile markers 98 to 131. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and slick roads may lead to accidents. A rapid drop in temperature may cause ice to form on roadways. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly. &&
